The problem is that his W's passive deals magic damage over time on his auto attacks, and its active deals an additional %missing health as magic damage. This coupled with Q proccing on-hit effects (w, BotRK, Devourer etc) makes him deal consistent mixed damage, including true damage with Skirmisher's Sabre, all of which is amplified by his ult. Ye Sion, Jax, Kennen, Poppy and Shyvana aren't mobile.

LOL

They are only mobile compared to Ashe or Brand though. Jax has 1 hop.  Kennen, Poppy, and Shyv have movement speed boosts, while Poppy has a targeted dash and Shyv her ult. Sion has his untargetable charge all over the map, but that doesn't come up too often. Sure some of them can move really fast, but compared to like....Lee Sin, Nidalee, Leblanc, Kassadin, Zed, Fizz, Kalista, you know, the champs that are listed in boards labelled  "OMG RITO NERF X PLS TOO MOBILE!"

Out of all you listed, only Nid, LB and Kassadin can actually catch up to Jax, Kennen, Poppy and Shyvana unless they are directly on top of them.

Lee Sin needs to hit you with a skillshot, Zed's W range isn't that great and his ult needs him to target you, one of Fizz's gapclosers has short range, other has a fairly long CD until you buy some CDR(which AD Fizz doesn't). Kalista needs a target to attack to be mobile, and before around 1.5 AS she maybe will catch Jax and Poppy.
No one said they were all running a race, this was talking about mobility. Running fast is not included in mobility. Also Lee can ward hop

Jax has a jump, and can also ward hop. Poppy has a dash and Shyvana also has a large dash.

So yes they are still mobile.

Also Kennen E pretty much gives him enough movement speed to travel the range of Flash under a second.

One mobility skill does not make them mobile. Poppy's in particular is very short ranged, needs a target, and is very situational, used most often to stun someone against a wall. Sure Jax can ward hop, but that takes away some of his damage. Lee can ward hop and then land his q to dash to you, losing no damage and gaining himself a shield. Jax hops in or hops out, one or the other, not both. Shyvana's speed boost makes her fairly quick, yes, and her ult lets her leap quite the distance....but it's still her ult, and will not be up nearly as the ones with the qwe mobility skills.

Nidalee has 1 mobility spell. So does Kass. 

Just saying
Yes, and they can spam it three or four times before the others can use it twice. That's the difference.
The cooldown on Jax's leap and Kennen's Maelstrom are both 10 / 9 / 8 / 7 / 6. If anything, that means a Jax with a ward is more mobile overall than the current version of Kassadin.
Kassadin's is 6/4/2 without cdr (if it can be reduced further, not sure). That means Jax is not more mobile.
You're right, I was thinking of the last patch combined with Jax's larger range.

Jax's range is 700. Kassadin's is 500 (according to the wiki). Assuming perfect, inhuman timing at point one of Jax's jump, he takes 20 seconds to leap twice. Kassadin can jump 3 times in 20 seconds. 1400 units for Jax 1500 for Kassadin. At Jax's lowest cooldown, he can jump twice in 12 seconds. Kassadin could jump 6 times in that same time period. So, Jax could jump 1400 units, while Kassadin jumps 3000. Absolutely no way Jax is more mobile.

Except not. Poppy, Shyv and Kennen MS mobility spells all have almost 100% uptimes at ranks 5 with a tiny bit of CDR. If Zed is considered super mobile for having his only mobility (which is the range of flash with a delay) on a 15 second cooldown and a 120 second cooldown, yes they are really mobile.
But again...movement speed is not considered mobility by all the people who qq about mobility on these threads.

A few of those champ's aren't really mixed damage dealers.

{{champion:10}} and {{champion:85}} deal mostly magic damage with a little bit of physical damage thrown in just because of how much they AA.

{{champion:75}} Deals a majority physical damage unless you're in an Aram. (where it's all magic) He has decent magic damage in the early/mid game but the damage is low enough that it becomes irrelevant with a null magic.

Out of the rest of these champs I'm going to subdivide into a few categories, If you look closely you'll see that Fizz doesn't really fall into any of them.

Mid damage tanky bruisers ({{champion:14}} , {{champion:102}} also {{champion:75}})
These champs have mixed damage because they don't build damage. Their high bases combined with mixed damage allows them to remain semi-relevant as damage threats even when build pure tank. Shyvana and Nasus need to be damage threats because of their lack of CC, admittedly Sion doesn't need to be in this category, he'd get by without mixed damage.

Late game hyper carries ({{champion:24}} , {{champion:96}} also {{champion:10}})
These champs are meant to be hard to itemise against. They're the guys you shut down because if you don't they can single handedly carry a game. They pay for their late game strength through their early game weaknesses.

Poppy ({{champion:78}})
Poppy's kit is an incoherent mess of random shit and should never be used as an example of a thought out design.

...last three patches...

Or you know, we can always gut her blindly, because that balance strategy worked so well for Kassadin and Veigar /s

First: Nid's W was nerfed. Not part of the major issue about Nidalee.
Second: Kass was nerfed because he has mobility AND damage. Do you see that reason? MOBILITY AND DAMAGE are why Kass was nerfed. Meanwhile Kass 2.0 hasn't been looked at all and the only defense I have heard for her so far is "they removed her silence".

The reason Nidalee is so strong in jungle is because she clears incredibly fast and at good health so she can exert pressure on the map earlier and more often than most junglers. They nerfed her W to nerf her clear speed (one of her oppressive strengths, and one that least affects her in other roles ie. Mid/Top). Nidalee jungle relies on snowballing early and/or skirmishes, she's pretty lackluster in teamfights compared to most junglers (ie. ones who actually have CC/tankiness). Yes, she has strengths as a jungler, just like every jungler *should* have; the strength that was most out-of-line/unnecessary was her clear speed, thus they nerfed that. Nerfing her clear speed nerfs her in pretty much every other aspect, since she takes longer to clear and therefore cannot be as present on the map, and thus has lower gold income for items (which, as an AP carry jungler, she is incredibly reliant on).

imo Kassadin was nerfed because Riot's balance team panicked after seeing him as a blind flex-pick in pro play. He was honestly fine before the range nerfs.

...are you talking about LeBlanc? When did she come into this conversation?

I merely chose a champion off the top of my head that fits the reason for nerf. I AM NOT SAYING SHE NEEDS A NERF, I merely think they bullshitted the reason.

About the bullshit reason....I was adding on to my comment on LB (which was just a top-of-the-head suggestion). Honestly I am fine with mobility and damage as long as I can look in their direction before I die and they don't 100-0 an entire TEAM in one go. But Riot's reason for nerfing Kass (having too much mobility and damage) was bullshit. Just like the Veig nerfs which you mentioned Veig nerfs being blind earlier.
